meanings.sent1: The farmer was blinkering the horse before the race.
meanings.sent2: The jockey was blinkering the horse to help it focus on the track.
meanings.sent3: The horse thought it was funny when the farmer started blinkering it.
meanings.sent4: The idea of blinkering a horse seemed strange to the city boy.
meanings.sent5: The image of blinkering a horse stayed in the child's mind for days.

meanings.definition: To restrict or limit one's perspective or awareness
meanings.sent1: She felt like blinkering herself from the negative news.
meanings.sent2: He was blinkering his thoughts to only see the positive side.
meanings.sent3: The idea of blinkering oneself from reality sounded silly to her.
meanings.sent4: Her fear was blinkering her ability to see the truth.
meanings.sent5: The concept of blinkering one's mind was hard for him to grasp.

meanings.definition: To focus narrowly on a particular issue or viewpoint
meanings.sent1: The team was blinkering their efforts on winning the championship.
meanings.sent2: She was blinkering her attention on solving the math problem.
meanings.sent3: Blinkering on the idea of winning made the game more intense.
meanings.sent4: He was blinkering on his goal, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent5: The coach's advice to keep blinkering on the target motivated the team.
